title: The long road to lazy preemption in the Linux CPU scheduler
dot:
digraph LazyPreemption{node[shape=box];A[label="Lazy Preemption in Kernel Scheduling" shape=ellipse];B[label="Current Preemption Modes"];C[label="PREEMPT_NONE
- Minimal Preemption
- Only after time slice expires"];D[label="PREEMPT_VOLUNTARY
- More preemption points
- Default mode"];E[label="PREEMPT_FULL
- Almost all points preemptible
- Prioritizes responsiveness"];F[label="PREEMPT_RT
- Real-time mode
- Highest priority for preemption"];G[label="Lazy Preemption Concept"];H[label="TIF_NEED_RESCHED_LAZY
- Indicates need for rescheduling
- Delays preemption"];I[label="TIF_NEED_RESCHED
- Immediate preemption if set"];J[label="Benefits"];K[label="Better throughput
- Less frequent preemption
- Suitable for long-running tasks"];L[label="Tradeoffs"];M[label="Higher latency in some cases
- Less responsive in low-priority tasks"];N[label="Future Goals"];O[label="Simplified Scheduler
- Only PREEMPT_LAZY and PREEMPT_FULL"];P[label="Remove cond_resched() Calls
- Streamlined preemption handling"];A->B;B->C;B->D;B->E;B->F;A->G;G->H;G->I;A->J;J->K;J->L;A->N;N->O;N->P;subgraph cluster_0{label="Current Challenges";style=dashed;color=lightgrey;node[shape=plaintext];Q[label="Heuristic nature of cond_resched()"];R[label="Need for performance testing"];S[label="Transition complexity"];Q->R;Q->S;}}
